page.title: 17COLLESSIE QUESTIONAIRE cont.
page.content: Because there are no shopping facilities in Collessie almost every household puchased its everyday goods from a visiting van owned by Mr. Ramsay. This van service travels daily from Kingskettle. For the main shopping items most people go to the neighbouring towns of Cupar, Perth and Glenrothes, with a few people travelling to Kinross and Dundee. Almost every household in the village owns a car with the exception of a few elderly residents who use public transport. From the suvey it appears that very few people use the bus services due to its relative infrequency. The general opinion of people in Collessie is that public transport services in the area are totally inadequate.
